name: Inktober 2021 - Day 4 - Knot
description:
The Ka is a musical instrument related to a rhythmic drum.

It is a drum of the Guadeloupean Gwoka, born during the period of slavery: this music has its origins in the perpetuation of African music by the slaves of the old plantations. The etymology of the word would be the Creole equivalent of the french word gros-quart, the usual capacity of the barrels from which the slaves made their instruments.

For the slaves, despite the prohibitions of the Black Code, music was a means of freedom, escape and communication, just like the Guadeloupean Creole language. This music, frowned upon for a long time in society, survived the post-colonial period, asserting itself as the first music and dance of Guadeloupe until it was listed in 2014 in the inventory of the intangible heritage of France at the Unesco!

Song: Akiyo - Neg
